ResearchProjectDef.label: simple gunsmithing
ResearchProjectDef.description: Allows for the creation of simple, muzzle-loading, flint-lock firearms at the smithy.

ResearchProjectDef.label: breech loading
ResearchProjectDef.description: Learn to create doors and hinges for loading firearms at the breech instead of clumsily down the barrel.

ResearchProjectDef.label: repeating actions
ResearchProjectDef.description: The advent of cartridges, lever-action, bolt-action, and hammers allows production of firearms which fire more reliably and at a faster rate.

ResearchProjectDef.label: rifling
ResearchProjectDef.description: Rudimentary rifling techniques allow for greater precision at range.

ResearchProjectDef.label: blowback operation
ResearchProjectDef.description: Gunsmiths have learned to harness a portion of kinetic energy once lost during firing and put it to use ejecting the casing and loading a fresh round into the chamber.

ResearchProjectDef.label: high caliber rounds
ResearchProjectDef.description: Stronger receivers and sturdy, large barrels allow high-grain bullets to be used. Where there was once a larger bullet, there is now a larger hole.

ResearchProjectDef.label: optics
ResearchProjectDef.description: Learn how to manufacture magnified optics for rifles.

ResearchProjectDef.label: advanced firearms
ResearchProjectDef.description: The full slew of modern firearms has arrived! It is terrifying.

ResearchProjectDef.label: multi barrel weapons
ResearchProjectDef.description: To solve the problem of barrel distortion caused by extremely high rates of fire, engineers have decided it's simplest to add more barrels to the design.

ResearchProjectDef.label: belt fed weapons
ResearchProjectDef.description: Traditional magazines only allowed users to fire 20 to 30 rounds before reloading. With belt-fed operation, firearms can now continuously fire up to 200 bullets!

ResearchProjectDef.label: .50 cal weapons
ResearchProjectDef.description: When the .40 wasn't big enough, Gunsmiths stepped up their game creating rock-solid receivers capable of bearing the brunt of the mighty .50 cal.

ResearchProjectDef.label: charged shot
ResearchProjectDef.description: Take it to the next level with pulse-charged projectile munitions.

ResearchProjectDef.label: simple grenades
ResearchProjectDef.description: Construct simple grenades from gunpowder, iron, oil, and glass.

ResearchProjectDef.label: advanced grenades
ResearchProjectDef.description: Better timed charges and housing have led to advances in thrown explosive technology.

ResearchProjectDef.label: grenade launchers
ResearchProjectDef.description: With human power only propelling an explosive device so far, engineers have devised pneumatic propulsion systems for delivery.
